section.title: Overview
section.para: This module collects extensions from &kamailio; core.

&kamailio; Core CookBook is available at:
http://kamailio.org/dokuwiki/

section.title: &kamailio; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
No dependencies on other &kamailio; modules.

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:
None.
Set the script flag.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: flag - the index of the script flag to be set. Can be integer or pseudo-variable with integer value.

section.para: This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Return true of the script flag is set.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: flag - the index of the script flag to be tested. Can be integer or pseudo-variable with integer value.

section.para: This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Reset the script flag.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: flag - the index of the script flag to be reset. Can be integer or pseudo-variable with integer value.

section.para: This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Set the branch flag.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: flag - the index of the branch flag to be set. Can be integer or pseudo-variable with integer value.
branch - the index of the branch whose flag to be set. Can be integer or pseudo-variable with integer value. If omitted, then branch 0 is used (R-URI).

section.para: This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Return true of the branch flag is set.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: flag - the index of the branch flag to be tested. Can be integer or pseudo-variable with integer value.
branch - the index of the branch whose flag to be set. Can be integer or pseudo-variable with integer value. If omitted, then branch 0 is used (R-URI).

section.para: This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Reset the branch flag.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: flag - the index of the branch flag to be reset. Can be integer or pseudo-variable with integer value.
branch - the index of the branch whose flag to be set. Can be integer or pseudo-variable with integer value. If omitted, then branch 0 is used (R-URI).

section.para: This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Set the destination address URI (outbound proxy address).
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: uri - Valid SIP URI representing the address where to send the request. It must be a static string, no variables are evaluated at runtime. If you need to set outbound proxy address via a variable, use assginment to $du.

section.para: This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Reset the destination address URI (outbound proxy address).
This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Check if the destination address URI (outbound proxy address) is set.
This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Evalues the str and sets the resulting value to variable var. For backward compatibility reasons, the same function can be executed via 'avp_printf(var, str)'.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: var - name of a writable variable
str - string that may contain variables which will be evaluated at runtime.

section.para: This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Check if the parameter matches the 'myself' condition (i.e., is a local IP or domain).
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: uri - Valid SIP URI or IP address to check against the list of local IP addresses or domains. The parameter value can contain pseudo-variables.

section.para: This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Set the debug log level per process.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: level - the debug log level to be set. Can be integer or pseudo-variable with integer value.

section.para: This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
Reset the local debug log level back to the value of core parameter 'debug'.
This function can be used from ANY_ROUTE.
This function was replaced by append_branch() from corex module, starting with version 4.0.0.
Print command line arguments.
Name: arg
Parameters: none.
MI FIFO Command Format:
Kill the application.
Name: kill
Parameters: none.
MI FIFO Command Format:
Print working directory.
Name: pwd
Parameters: none.
MI FIFO Command Format:
Print uptime.
Name: uptime
Parameters: none.
MI FIFO Command Format:
Print version information.
Name: version
Parameters: none.
MI FIFO Command Format:
Print list of available MI commands.
Name: which
Parameters: none.
MI FIFO Command Format:
Print the list of available internal statistics.
Name: get_statistics

Parameters: statsid - which statistics to be printed. If set to 'all' then all statistics are printed; if set to 'statsgroup:' then all statistics in the group are printed; if set to 'statsname' then the statistics identified by the name is printed.
MI FIFO Command Format:
Reset internal statistics.
Name: reset_statistics
Parameters: statsid - which statistics to be reset, give as name.
MI FIFO Command Format:
Return statistics and reset their value in one command.
Name: get_statistics
Parameters: statsid - same as for get_statistics.
MI FIFO Command Format:

Print private memory (pkg) usage statistics per process. It can take optinally a filter to print statistics only for a specific process or set of processes. If no filter is given, it prints statistics for all processes.
The filter can be:

listitem.para: pid value - print statistics for specific process pid.
rank value - print statistics for specific process rank.
index value - print statistics for specific index in process table.

section.para: Examples:
section.programlisting: &sercmd; pkg.stats &sercmd; pkg.stats pid 1234 &sercmd; pkg.stats rank 1 &sercmd; pkg.stats index 10

section.para: Print the list of available internal statistics.

Parameters: statsid - which statistics to be printed. If set to 'all' then all statistics are printed; if set to 'statsgroup:' then all statistics in the group are printed; if set to 'statsname' then the statistics identified by the name is printed.
Examples:
section.programlisting: &sercmd; stats.get_statistics all &sercmd; stats.get_statistics core: &sercmd; stats.get_statistics unsupported_methods &sercmd; stats.get_statistics shmem: fwd_requests fwd_replies

section.para: Reset internal statistics.
Parameters: statsid - same as for get_statistics.
Examples:
section.programlisting: &sercmd; stats.reset_statistics all &sercmd; stats.reset_statistics core: &sercmd; stats.reset_statistics unsupported_methods &sercmd; stats.reset_statistics shmem: fwd_requests fwd_replies

section.para: Return statistics and reset their value in one command.
Parameters: statsid - same as for get_statistics.
Examples:
section.programlisting: &sercmd; stats.reset_statistics all &sercmd; stats.reset_statistics core: &sercmd; stats.reset_statistics unsupported_methods &sercmd; stats.reset_statistics shmem: fwd_requests fwd_replies
